intro: Conioselinum coloradense, commonly known as the Colorado tansy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Conioselinum coloradense is often found in Colorado and adjacent regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
